snippet: The infiltration was part of an effort to dismantle the criminal organizations wreaking havoc south of the border, according to newly obtained Mexican government documents.
abstract: Mexican government documents reveal that American drug enforcement agents posing as money launderers in 2007 secretly helped Mexican drug trafficker Arturo Beltran Leyva and his principal Colombian cocaine supplier Harold Mauricio Poveda-Ortega move millions in drug proceeds; undercover work was effort to infiltrate and dismantle criminal organizations wreaking havoc in Mexico.

byline.contributor: Randal C. Archibold contributed reporting from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: The infiltration was part of an effort to dismantle the criminal organizations wreaking havoc south of the border, according to newly obtained Mexican government documents.

headline.seo: U.S. Agents Aided Mexican Drug Trafficker to Infiltrate Ring
headline.main: U.S. Agents Aided Mexican Drug Trafficker to Infiltrate His Criminal Ring
headline.print_headline: U.S. Agents Aided Mexican Drug Trafficker to Infiltrate His Criminal Ring
